cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest through the Florida Straits, expected to cross or brush the Florida Keys tonight then turn west into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Florida Keys (near Marathon-Key Largo corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida coast from Golden Beach to Bonita Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida coast from Brevard/Volusia County line southward around the peninsula to Englewood
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coastline including Miami-Dade, Broward (Port Everglades), and Palm Beach counties, and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40-50 mph) with gusts up to 68 mph already measured at Port Everglades; similar or slightly stronger gusts likely through early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible along the Broward coastline, causing minor coastal flooding at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 18 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible; dangerous marine conditions and very rough seas immediately offshore.
